p: All variables were log-transformed (using base 10 logs) to improve the data distribution and homogeneity of variances. The data were tested for normality by comparing histograms of the sample data to a normal probability curve, after which the null hypothesis (that data were normally distributed) was rejected. To compare and plot the effects of different pretreatments on the chemical composition of essential oils for each plant (as determined by GC-MS), we applied Spearman’s nonparametric measure of rank correlation using program R v. 3.2.0 [ 45]. The level of significance was set at p ≤ 0.05.
